body: Is Better Sprint Mod alloyed in avicus?
body_tagged: Is Better Sprint Mod alloyed in avicus?
title: Is BSM alloyed?

replies.body: I'm pretty sure it isn't allowed.
replies.body_tagged: I'm pretty sure it isn't allowed.

replies.body: I'm going to guess no due to in the rules (http://avicus.net/rules) under section C rule 10 it clearly states for no sprint assists.
replies.body_tagged: I'm going to guess no due to in the rules (http://avicus.net/rules) under section C rule 10 it clearly states for no sprint assists.

replies.body: just find your assigned sprint button xD, instead of double clicking w you can press that button and it automatically makes you run, just hold it and if you run into a block and then you jump over it you run.
replies.body_tagged: just find your assigned sprint button xD, instead of double clicking w you can press that button and it automatically makes you run, just hold it and if you run into a block and then you jump over it you run.

replies.body: The sprint button is better than BSM.
replies.body_tagged: The sprint button is better than BSM.

replies.body: BSM can allows you to sprint with any button like ''R''
replies.body_tagged: BSM can allows you to sprint with any button like ''R''

replies.body:
Actually no it's not. BSM gives less of a delay between sprint activation and deactivation. Leading to way more OP combos. 

All the really good sword pvpers are most likely using something along the lines of it unless they have insanely OP pings
replies.body_tagged:

reply_to.body: The sprint button is better than BSM.
reply_to.body_tagged: The sprint button is better than BSM.

replies.body:
"All the really good sword pvpers are most likely using something along the lines of it unless they have insanely OP pings" - I'm pretty sure that nobody uses them, they are just generally good at strafing and pvp strategies in general.

ON TOPIC - No, the Better Sprint Mod is not allowed in Avicus.

replies.body: HattoWolf used one I'm pretty sure, a lot of the famous YT soup pvpers do. A really OP pot pvper does too, he even said playing without it is a huge difference

replies.body: No, Sprint Assist mods aren't allowed.
